summary: This is an email chain from July 2, 2020, between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel. The key message announces the unsealing of an indictment and arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in New Hampshire that morning, charging her with facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minors.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the subject of an unsealed indictment, arrested in New Hampshire, and charged with facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual whose abuse of minors Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with facilitating.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as an associate of Epstein, charged with facilitating his abuse of minors.

events.title: Arrest and Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell was unsealed, and she was arrested in New Hampshire. She is charged with facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minors.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in New Hampshire on July 2, 2020.
An indictment against Maxwell was unsealed that morning, charging her with facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minors.
The presentment for Maxwell was not scheduled to occur in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) on that day.
The communication is an internal heads-up from the Chief of the Criminal Division at the U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, regarding the arrest.
The email chain indicates coordination around the arrest just before a holiday weekend during the COVID-19 pandemic.
